1. Central pontine syndrome
2. Huntington disease
3. Metachromatic leucocytosis
4. Korsakoff syndrome
5. Familial focal dystonic chorea
6. Giant arteriovenous malformation
7. Oculomotor nerve or optic nerve palsy
8. Dystonia with myoclonus
9. Primary progressive ataxia
10. Primary progressive ataxia type

I recommend consulting with a neurologist or a geneticist for further diagnosis and management of this patient case.
